title: NSW Waratahs defeat Fijian Drua in Super Rugby Pacific round two, Pete Samu plays after birth of child
desc: Wallabies veteran Pete Samu has helped the NSW Waratahs to consecutive wins to start the Super Rugby Pacific season, just hours after the birth of his child.

title: Protest planned at FAI headquarters over Ireland's Nations League matches against Israel
desc: Ireland has been drawn into the same group as Israel, Austria and Kosovo for the Nations League.

title: Rare Watches Inspired by Apple and Google Employees Go on Sale
desc: Watch collector clubs inside Apple and Google have collaborated with watchmaker Tudor on limited-edition timepieces that are available for resale.

title: Southville International School and Colleges signs clean energy partnership with First Gen

title: UK Athletics admits causing death of Paralympian hit on head by pole
desc: Abdullah Hayayei, 36, who represented the United Arab Emirates, was fatally injured at Newham Leisure Centre, east London, nine years ago. The national governing body for athletics has now admitted corporate manslaughter, having previously denied the charge.

title: Ex-Welsh Premier footballer charged with attempted murder
desc: He had spells with Manchester United and Liverpool as an academy player

title: Gentoo Penguins on Heard Island First Birds in Australia Infected with H5N1
desc: Gentoo penguins hit by bird flu on Australia's Heard Island.

title: NESR Expands Services in Libya with New Initiatives to Boost O&G Production
desc: According to Chairman and CEO Sherif Foda, the company is introducing new technology to unlock Libya’s untapped resources.

title: Google cleans house, bans 80,000 developer accounts from the Play Store
desc: Google strengthens its Android safe app ecosystem, blocking malicious apps and boosting developer and user protections in 2025.
